abstract.p: Brazil's industrial output rises 3.3 percent in April, compared with last year, ninth consecutive month of growth; output of consumer and nondurable goods fell by 7 percent in April, compared with year ago (S)

block.p: Brazil's industrial output rose 3.3 percent in April compared with last year, the ninth consecutive month of growth. Auto and electronics makers led the advance, as declining domestic interest rates fostered an increase in demand for durable goods. Automakers also increased exports by 78.9 percent in the first four months of the year compared with a year earlier. The output of consumer and nondurable goods fell by 7 percent in April compared with the year-earlier period, under pressure from falling wine production.

Brazil's industrial output rose 3.3 percent in April compared with last year, the ninth consecutive month of growth. Auto and electronics makers led the advance, as declining domestic interest rates fostered an increase in demand for durable goods. Automakers also increased exports by 78.9 percent in the first four months of the year compared with a year earlier. The output of consumer and nondurable goods fell by 7 percent in April compared with the year-earlier period, under pressure from falling wine production.
